title: On the existence of spinning solitons in gauge field theory
abstract: We study the existence of classical soliton solutions with intrinsic angular momentum in Yang-Mills-Higgs theory with a compact gauge group $\mathcal{G}$ in 3+1 dimensional Minkowski space. We show that for \textit{symmetric} gauge fields the Noether charges corresponding to \textit{rigid} spatial symmetries, as the angular momentum, can be expressed in terms of \textit{surface} integrals. Using this result, we demonstrate the non-existence of stationary and axially symmetric spinning excitations for all known topological solitons in the case of $\mathcal{G}=SU(2)$, that is for 't Hooft-Polyakov monopoles, Julia-Zee dyons, sphalerons and also vortices.
